class_notes:
This course will focus on the functional consequences of protein structure in the context of the nervous system. We will explore molecular structure-function relationships that affect neuronal function and, thus, behavior. Topics may include the molecular basis of channel mutations that cause epilepsy, autoimmune conditions, chemical warfare, drug design, and other topics of students¿ choice. In this class, we will use case studies and other active-learning activities to drive our exploration of molecular interactions underlying behavior. Assessments will include student presentations, individual and collaborative quizzes, and other assignments.
